```{r Inputting data & making sure everything is organized correctly}
pam_all_ammonium.data <- read.csv("PAM_ammonium_only_3_5_23.csv", header=TRUE, sep=",",stringsAsFactors = FALSE)

#getting rid of all the extra data at the bottom-- we only want rows 1:959 OR 1:639 if only looking at exp 2 and 3 (remember we got rid of the outlier!)
#pam_all_ammonium.data  <- pam_all_ammonium.data[(1:482),]
pam_all_ammonium.data <- na.omit(pam_all_ammonium.data)


#changing some column names
pam_all_ammonium.data<-subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, select = -c(temp))
#renaming columns in base R because dplyr is freaking out
colnames(pam_all_ammonium.data)[colnames(pam_all_ammonium.data) == "sym_state"] ="sym_state_full"
colnames(pam_all_ammonium.data)[colnames(pam_all_ammonium.data) == "sym_state.1"] ="sym_state"
colnames(pam_all_ammonium.data)[colnames(pam_all_ammonium.data) == "temp.1"] ="temp"

#Setting everything I need as factors for linear model and stats
pam_all_ammonium.data$N_species<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$N_species)
pam_all_ammonium.data$N_dose<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$N_dose)
pam_all_ammonium.data$N_species_dose<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$N_species_dose)
pam_all_ammonium.data$temp<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$temp)
pam_all_ammonium.data$food<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$food)
pam_all_ammonium.data$sym_state<-as.character(pam_all_ammonium.data$sym_state)
pam_all_ammonium.data$food_sym_state<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$food_sym_state)

summary(pam_all_ammonium.data$temp)

#lets check for normality in PAM_delta
hist(pam_all_ammonium.data$PAM_delta)
qqnorm(pam_all_ammonium.data$PAM_delta, main = NULL)
# it looks pretty normal

hist(pam_all_ammonium.data$PAM_avg_day1) # eh
qqnorm(pam_all_ammonium.data$PAM_avg_day1, main = NULL)

hist(pam_all_ammonium.data$PAM_avg_day11) # eh
qqnorm(pam_all_ammonium.data$PAM_avg_day11, main = NULL)

```


```{r Basic list of subsets}
# all aposymbiotic
all_apo<-subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, pam_all_ammonium.data$sym_state=="A")
# all symbiotic
all_sym<-subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, pam_all_ammonium.data$sym_state=="S")
# all fed
all_fed<-subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, pam_all_ammonium.data$food=="F")
# all starved
all_starved<-subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, pam_all_ammonium.data$food=="S")
# all 20C
all_20<-subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, pam_all_ammonium.data$temp=="20")
# all 30C
all_30<-subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, pam_all_ammonium.data$temp=="30")

#without controls
no_controls <- subset(pam_all_ammonium.data, pam_all_ammonium.data$N_dose!=0)
```




# LINEAR MODELS

```{r getting data ready for lmer}
pam_all_ammonium.data$N_species<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$N_species)
pam_all_ammonium.data$N_dose<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$N_dose)
pam_all_ammonium.data$N_species_dose<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$N_species_dose)
pam_all_ammonium.data$temp<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$temp)
pam_all_ammonium.data$food<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$food)
pam_all_ammonium.data$sym_state<-as.factor(pam_all_ammonium.data$sym_state)

summary(pam_all_ammonium.data$sym_state)
```


```{r PAM delta Model selection }
full.model_pam_ammonium <- lmer(PAM_delta ~  N_species_dose + temp + food + sym_state + N_species_dose*temp + N_species_dose*food + N_species_dose*sym_state + temp*food + temp*sym_state + food*sym_state +  (1|col_num) + (1|exp_num) , data= pam_all_ammonium.data)
summary(full.model_pam_ammonium)
print(step.model<- step(full.model_pam_ammonium))
#Model found:
#PAM_delta ~ N_species_dose + sym_state + (1 | col_num) + (1 | exp_num) + N_species_dose:sym_state

mm_pam_1 <- lmer(PAM_delta ~ temp + sym_state + food + N_species_dose*sym_state + (1 | col_num) + (1 | exp_num) + temp*food + temp*sym_state, data=pam_all_ammonium.data)
summary(mm_pam_1)
#sym state is VERY significant
#temp is also overall significant

# WINNER # WINNER # WINNER # WINNER # WINNER # WINNER

#lets try some other models 
mm_pam_2 <- lmer(PAM_delta ~ N_species_dose + N_species_dose*sym_state + sym_state + food + temp + (1 | col_num) + (1 | exp_num), data=pam_all_ammonium.data)
summary(mm_pam_2)


mm_pam_3 <- lmer(PAM_delta ~ temp + food + sym_state + (1 | col_num) + (1 | exp_num) + temp*food + temp*sym_state, data=pam_all_ammonium.data)
summary(mm_pam_3)


mm_pam_4 <- lmer(PAM_delta ~ temp + sym_state + N_species_dose*sym_state+ (1 | col_num) + (1 | exp_num) + temp*food + temp*sym_state, data=pam_all_ammonium.data)

AIC(mm_pam_1, mm_pam_4)

#mm1 is our winner

plot_model(mm_pam_1, type="diag") #data fitness looks decent
r2(mm_pam_1) #random explains 30%

```

```{r PAM delta Model posthocs}
# ammonium dose posthoc
#NOT IN THE MODEL! Let's just double check by adding it to another model and then doing a posthoc
emm_pam_dose=emmeans(mm_pam_2, specs=pairwise ~ N_species_dose)
summary(emm_pam_dose)
#Yep, no differences rip
# What about N species dose and sym state, we added this to the model because it was significant
emm_pam_sym_state_dose=emmeans(mm_pam_1, specs=pairwise ~ N_species_dose*sym_state)
summary(emm_pam_sym_state_dose)
 # contrast              estimate     SE  df t.ratio p.value
 # A_10 A - A_7.5 S       0.12488 0.0349 457   3.575  0.0092
 # A_5 A - A_7.5 S        0.14338 0.0345 460   4.152  0.0010
 # A_7.5 A - A_7.5 S      0.12997 0.0348 456   3.736  0.0052
 # CNTRL_0 A - A_7.5 S    0.15131 0.0348 459   4.353  0.0004
# What about N species dose and temp, we added this to the model but let's take it out because NOT SIGNFICANT
emm_pam_temp_dose=emmeans(mm_pam_1, specs=pairwise ~ N_species_dose*temp)
summary(emm_pam_temp_dose)
 # contrast              estimate     SE  df t.ratio p.value
 # A_10 A - A_7.5 S       0.12488 0.0349 457   3.575  0.0092
 # A_5 A - A_7.5 S        0.14338 0.0345 460   4.152  0.0010
 # A_7.5 A - A_7.5 S      0.12997 0.0348 456   3.736  0.0052
 # CNTRL_0 A - A_7.5 S    0.15131 0.0348 459   4.353  0.0004


# Sym state posthoc
emm_pam_sym_state=emmeans(mm_pam_1, specs=pairwise ~ sym_state)
summary(emm_pam_sym_state) # p= <0.001

# food posthoc
emm_pam_food=emmeans(mm_pam_1, specs=pairwise ~ food)
summary(emm_pam_food) # p= 0.41


#Temperature from the whole model
emm_pam_temp=emmeans(mm_pam_1, specs=pairwise ~ temp)
summary(emm_pam_temp) # p= 0.05

# Sym state by temp
emm_pam_temp_sym_state=emmeans(mm_pam_1, specs=pairwise ~ temp*sym_state)
summary(emm_pam_temp_sym_state)
 # contrast            estimate     SE  df t.ratio p.value
 # temp20 A - temp30 A   0.0311 0.0240 462   1.298  0.5645
 # temp20 A - temp20 S   0.1532 0.0261 343   5.867  <.0001
 # temp20 A - temp30 S   0.0577 0.0259 363   2.227  0.1179
 # temp30 A - temp20 S   0.1220 0.0264 341   4.626  <.0001
 # temp30 A - temp30 S   0.0265 0.0260 373   1.020  0.7380
 # temp20 S - temp30 S  -0.0955 0.0239 455  -3.997  0.0004

```

```{r Symbiotic State - PAM_delta}
# AMMONIUM ONLY

# plot, treatment x axis colored by site data figure
pam_treatmeans_apovsym <- summarySE(pam_all_ammonium.data, measurevar=c("PAM_delta"),groupvars =c("sym_state"), na.rm=TRUE)
gg_pam_plot_apovsym <- ggplot(pam_treatmeans_apovsym, aes(x = sym_state, y= c(PAM_delta), color = sym_state))+
  theme_bw()+
  geom_point(size = 3, position = position_dodge(width=0.3))+
  geom_smooth(aes(group=sym_state), position = position_dodge(width=0.3), size = 0.5, method='lm', se = FALSE)+
 # geom_jitter(aes(), size=1.2, alpha=0.9)+
  geom_line(aes(group = sym_state), size = 0.5, linetype="dashed", position = position_dodge(width=0.3))+
  geom_errorbar(aes(x = sym_state, ymax = PAM_delta+se, ymin = PAM_delta-se), width = .2, position = position_dodge(width=0.3)) +
  #scale_color_manual(name = "Treatment",
                    #labels = c("Control 30C Fed","Control 30C Starved","Ammonium High 30C Fed", "Ammonium High 30C Starved","test"),
                    # values = c("orchid1","darkorchid1","royalblue","skyblue","black","gray","brown"))+
 ylab("Change in Fv/Fm Pre vs. Post-experiment")+
  ggtitle("Change in Fv/Fm Sym vs. Apo - Ammonium")+
 labs(caption = "data represent mean +/- SEM, p=<0.0001***")+
  scale_x_discrete("Symboitic State", labels=c(A="Aposymbiotic", S="Symbiotic"))+ #relabels the x axis to the values in quotations
    scale_color_manual("Symboitic State", labels=c(A="Aposymbiotic", S="Symbiotic"), values=c("gray", "brown")) #gives you the colors for each point on the graph
gg_pam_plot_apovsym

# Summarize by temp and N species dose so we can visualize
sum_N_species_dose_sym_state_ammonium <- summarySE(pam_all_ammonium.data, measurevar = "PAM_delta", groupvars = c("sym_state","N_species_dose"))
# Visualize
gg_N_species_dose_sym_state_ammonium<-ggplot(data = sum_N_species_dose_sym_state_ammonium,
       aes(x = N_species_dose,
           y = PAM_delta, colour=sym_state)) +
    geom_point() +
    geom_errorbar(aes(ymin=PAM_delta-se, ymax=PAM_delta+se), width=0.1, size = 1) +
    #scale_color_manual(values = c("black", "darkgreen")) +
    ggtitle ("Ammonium - Change in Fv/Fm by sym state and dose") +
    
   # scale_x_discrete(labels=c("20C","30C"))+
    labs(x = "ammonium dose", 
         y = expression(paste("Change in Photosynthetic Efficiency Fv/Fm")), 
         caption = "data represent mean +/- SEM" ) +
    scale_x_discrete("ammonium dose", labels=c(CNTRL_0="Control", A_5="1.5uM", A_7.5="7.5um", A_10="10um"))+
    scale_color_manual("Sym State", labels=c("Aposymbiotic","Symbiotic"), values=c("gray", "brown"))
gg_N_species_dose_sym_state_ammonium
# Summarize by food and sym state so we can visualize

   #scale_fill_manual(name="Feeding Regime", labels=c('Fed', 'Starved'))+
 # scale_fill_manual(values=c("brown", "darkgray"))+

 scale_color_manual(values=c("orange", "black"))
```
